anyOf.description: When set to a number without an unit, the unit used is the one set in the general `document.json` config. If it isn't there, it fallbacks to `um`.

columnOrTextWidth.description: The basis used to calculate the width.

oneOf.description: A color ID if `colors.json` has been imported.
A color object containing the keys to format a CMYK color.
A color object containing the keys to format a RGB color.
A color object containing the keys to format a LAB color.

paragraphs.description: Object containing paragraph styles. The key's name becomes the paragraph style's name.

isSnippet.description: If set to true, that block doesn't generate a new paragraph style but is available for later use it with "useSnippet" in another paragraph style.

useSnippets.description:
Snippets to apply to the paragraph style. Can be used inside paragraph styles that are also snippets or specify non-snippet paragraph styles and it'll work as expected.

It uses no InDesign built-in inheritance but applies the properties directly.

basedOn.description:
On which other paragraph style this one should be based. The input is the name of the target paragraph style.

Uses InDesign's built-in inheritance functionnality.

nextStyle.description: The style to apply to new paragraphs that follow paragraphs tagged with this style.

overprint.description: If true, the stroke of the characters will overprint.

miterLimit.description: The limit of the ratio of stroke width to miter length before a miter (pointed) join becomes a bevel (squared-off) join.

overprint.description: If true, the stroke of the characters will overprint.
If true, the strikethrough will overprint.

gapOverprint.description: If true, the gap of the strikethrough will overprint.

overprint.description: If true, the underline will overprint.

gapOverprint.description: If true, the gap of the underline will overprint.

horizontalScale.description: The horizontal scaling applied to the glyphs.

verticalScale.description: The vertical scaling applied to the glyphs.

skew.description: Slant of the font in degrees.

rotation.description: A value in degrees in which to rotate characters. Applied individually for each glyph and unclock-wise.

letterSpacing.description: Kerning, tracking and other letter positioning options.

kerning.description: Adjusting the space between specific pairs of letters in a piece of text.

tracking.description:
Adjusting the space between all letters in a piece of text.

Specified in thousands of an em.

ligatures.description: If true, replaces specific character combinations (e.g., fl, fi) with ligature characters.

contextualAlternate.description: If true, uses contextual alternate forms in OpenType fonts.

discretionaryLigature.description: If true, uses discretionary ligatures in OpenType fonts.

figureStyle.description: The figure style in OpenType fonts.

fraction.description: If true, uses fractions in OpenType fonts.

historical.description: If true, use historical forms in OpenType fonts.

justificationAlternate.description: If true, use alternate justification forms in OpenType fonts

locale.description: If true, uses localized forms in OpenType fonts.

mark.description: If true, uses mark positioning in OpenType fonts.

ordinal.description: If true, uses ordinals in OpenType fonts.

overlapSwash.description: If true, use overlapping swash forms in OpenType fonts

proportionalMetrics.description: If true, kerns according to proportional CJK metrics in OpenType fonts.

romanItalics.description: If true, applies italics to half-width alphanumerics.

slashedZero.description: If true, use a slashed zeroes in OpenType fonts.

stretchedAlternate.description: If true, use stretched alternate forms in OpenType fonts

stylisticAlternate.description: If true, use stylistic alternate forms in OpenType fonts

stylisticSets.description: The stylistic sets to use in OpenType fonts.

swash.description: If true, uses swash forms in OpenType fonts.

titling.description: If true, uses titling forms in OpenType fonts.

HVKana.description: If true, switches hiragana fonts, which have different glyphs for horizontal and vertical.

smallCharacterAlignment.description: The alignment of small characters to the largest character in the line.

length.description: The number of characters to drop cap.

lines.description: The number of lines to drop cap.

characterStyle.description: A character style ID to apply to the drop cap.

noBreak.description: If true, disables ALL automatic line breaks.

keepLinesTogether.description: If set, keeps a specified number of lines together when the paragraph breaks across columns or text frames.

firstLines.description: The minimum number of lines to keep together in a paragraph before allowing a page break.

lastLines.description: The minimum number of lines to keep together in a paragraph after a page break.

keepWithNext.description: The minimum number of lines to keep with the next paragraph.

keepWithPrevious.description: If the first line in the paragraph should be kept with the last line of previous paragraph.

keepAllLinesTogether.description: If true, keeps all lines of the paragraph together. If false, allows paragraphs to break across pages or columns.

firstLineIndent.description: The width in unit to indent the first line.

lastLineIndent.description: The width in unit to indent the last line.

leftIndent.description: The width of the left indent.

rightIndent.description: The width of the right indent.

ignoreEdgeAlignment.description: If true, ignores optical edge alignment for the paragraph.

undesirability.description: The relative desirability of better spacing over fewer hyphens. A lower value results in greater use of hyphens.

hyphenateAcrossColumns.description: If true, allows the last word in a text column to be hyphenated.

hyphenateAfter.description: The mininum number of letters at the beginning of a word that can be broken by a hyphen.

hyphenateBefore.description: The minimum number of letters at the end of a word that can be broken by a hyphen.

hyphenateLadderLimit.description: The maximum number of hyphens that can appear on consecutive lines. To specify unlimited consecutive lines, use zero.

hyphenateLastWord.description: If true, allows hyphenation in the last word in a paragraph.

allowArbitraryHyphenation.description: If true, words unassociated with a hyphenation dictionary can break to the next line on any character.

hyphenationZone.description: The amount of white space allowed at the end of a line of non-justified text before hypenation begins.

justificationScaling.definition: Glyph scaling, word spacing and letter spacing preferences.

minimum.description: The minimum width (%) of individual characters.

desired.description: The desired width (%) of individual characters.

maximum.description: The maximum width (%) of individual characters.

minimum.description: The minimum letter spacing (%) of the built-in space between letters in the font.

desired.description: The desired letter spacing (%) of the built-in space between letters in the font.

maximum.description: The maximum letter spacing (%) of the built-in space between letters in the font.

minimum.description: The minimum word spacing (%) of the font word space value.

desired.description: The desired word spacing (%) of the font word space value.

maximum.description: The maximum word spacing (%) of the font word space value.

characterStyle.description: A character style ID to apply to the bullets.

numberingExpression.definition: The number string expression (format) for numbering.

anyOf.description: Either the number of sub-columns to generate or the number of columns to span, depending on the mode.
If the type is "SPAN_COLUMNS", spans over all columns.

insideGutter.definition: The gutter to apply between sub-columns.

outsideGutter.definition: The gutter to apply around the sub-columns group.

tabs.description: The tabulations. Can be indiviudally set, generated or both.

repeated.description: Each set of rules inside the array will be executed to generate new tabs.

alignToCharacter.description: On which string a CHARACTER_ALIGN tabulation should align.

individuals.description:
Applies each tab individually.

By default, they inherit from the previous one. For exemple, if all tabs should be LEFT_ALIGN, setting it for the first tab will apply for all the following tabs until it is set to something else. Does NOT work with position.

alignToCharacter.description: On which string a CHARACTER_ALIGN tabulation should align.

displayIfSplits.description: If the paragraph is split across multiple blocks, whether to display the border at those breakpoints.

endCap.description: The end shape of an open path.

endJoin.description: The corner join applied to the paragraph style.

printAndExport.description: Whether to include the background in exports and for print.

clipToFrame.description: If the background would be larger than the text frame, clip it to its size.
